Just replayed this during the Spring Cleaning event and I've got to say, I totally forgot how polished this puzzle game is and kinda reminded me of that "Valve quality", that is so highly regarded. After years of playing DotA and CSGO, which are games that just make you hate yourself, it's easy to forget.

Do yourself a favor, drop whatever game you're playing for just 4 hours and play this game again. If you haven't ever played this game yet, wtf is wrong with you?!

(Few hours because I mostly played this game on xbox 360, which is where I beat it)

It was my favorite game of all time when I first beat it in 2012, and it's my favorite game of all time today.

No other game: not BioShock Infinite, not Bloodborne, not anything can even come close to just how much fun this game is not only the first time you play it, but every time you play it; whether it be alone or co-op. Co-op is a different story; it's definitely one of the most entertaining and enthralling co-op experience you can get in any game - literally anyone was willing to try it out, even my mother.

Nothing about this game is flawed. Seriously. If you don't enjoy it, it's purely because you can't find enjoyment in the concept, which is perfectly understandable; however, there is nothing inherently [i] wrong [/i] with the game. The story is rich and endearing, the characters, even when you don't see them, are hilarious and give so much life to the dilapidated and depressing setting. Every piece of contrast in this game works as a set of perfect compliments, like Ornstein and Smough from Dark Souls. The gameplay is vast, unique, and much improved from the first game, and the lore is richer and deeper. I could go on for paragraphs, but this is all I'm gonna say. This game is perfect. 100/10 would burn my house down with lemons again.

My favourite puzzle game of all time, and quite possibly one of the best I've ever played. The level design is fantastic and uses very clever mechanics very effectively. The portal gun is an incredibly fun 'weapon' to use. One thing that distinguishes this puzzle title from many others are the characters. Whatley and Glados are excellent characters and extremely witty. Even Cave Johnson, which you only hear but never see is also an incredible character. And the voice acting is some of the best. And once the single player is over, you have the coop campaign, which is huge and extremely fun as well. This game is pretty cheap and has aged surprisingly well. This game really made me appreciate Valve's titles and I could recommend this game to anyone, professional or not. A fantastic entry point into the video game art form.
